medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced acute onset RUQ pain since this morning. He woke up with nausea and vomiting (4 episodes), and the abdominal pain has been persistent. One week prior, he had a similar pain that resolved after vomiting. He denies diarrhea, fever, chills, cough, sore throat, rhinorrhea, and chest pain. Reports some subjective shortness of breath and dizziness.
